newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-TIGERS CATCHER MATT WALBECK SUFFERS BROKEN WRIST.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-TIGERS CATCHER MATT WALBECK SUFFERS BROKEN WRIST.

text.p: Detroit Tigers catcher Matt Walbeck suffered a broken wrist in Friday's 9-5 loss to the Oakland Athletics and will be out for two to three months.
Walbeck sustained the injury diving for a popup in the eighth inning, during which Oakland scored six runs. The 29-year-old Walbeck is batting .276 with one home run and five RBI in nine games.
Detroit will recall catcher Raul Casanova from Triple-A Toledo of the International League, where he is batting just .195 with one homer and three RBI in 12 games.
